verses.roman:
ṭhākurera nāsāte yadi chidra thākita
tabe ei dāsī muktā nāsāya parāita

synonyms: ṭhākurera nāsāte—in the nose of the Deity; yadi—if; chidra—a hole; thākita—there were; tabe—then; ei—this; dāsī—maidservant; muktā—pearl; nāsāya—on the nose; parāita—could put on.
translation: "If there were a hole in the Deity's nose, I could transfer the pearl to Him."
